devdoc.author: ibourn
devdoc.details: This contract is a plugin for the DAO, it is used to validate or invalidate a poll. It's splitted as a plugin to allow upgradability and flexibility and to reduce the size of the DAO contract

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.

submitPoll(address,uint256,uint256).details: no existing poll have initial id 0, so we use it to check if the poll is already submittedthe poll calling can't be ID 0 as its status don't allow it to resubmitA fake contract could call it again without status restriction and thus later have side effect on validation vote but as only the poll address are stored and validator have to callthemselves the poll to check its description and validate it, it's not a problem, they will vote against itA check could be to compare this poll address with a mapping in the factory to check if it's a clone

params._pollAddress: the address of the poll to submit
params._toDAO: the amount of ETH to pay to the DAO
params._toValidators: the amount of ETH to pay to validators

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: DPollPluginValidator

submitPoll(address,uint256,uint256).notice: allows to submit a poll to the DAO

userdoc.notice: This contract is used to manage the polls validation
